name: Bulbasaur
information: For some time after its birth, it uses the nutrients that are packed into the seed on its back in order to grow.

name: Ivysaur
information: The more sunlight Ivysaur bathes in, the more strength wells up within it, allowing the bud on its back to grow larger.

name: Venusaur
information: While it basks in the sun, it can convert the light into energy. As a result, it is more powerful in the summertime.

name: Charmander
information: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life-force. If Charmander is weak, the flame also burns weakly.

name: Charmeleon
information: When it swings its burning tail, the temperature around it rises higher and higher, tormenting its opponents.

name: Charizard
information: If Charizard becomes truly angered, the flame at the tip of its tail burns in a light blue shade.

name: Squirtle
information: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It sprays a potent foam from its mouth.

name: Wartortle
information: Wartortle’s long, furry tail is a symbol of longevity, so this Pokémon is quite popular among older people.

name: Blastoise
information: It deliberately increases its body weight so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.

name: Caterpie
information: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

name: Metapod
information: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

name: Butterfree
information: It loves the nectar of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

name: Weedle
information: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

name: Kakuna
information: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

name: Beedrill
information: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

name: Pidgey
information: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

name: Pidgeotto
information: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

name: Pidgeot
information: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: Rattata
information: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

name: Raticate
information: ts hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

name: Spearow
information: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

name: Fearow
information: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: Ekans
information: It can freely detach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can become too heavy to move, however.

name: Arbok
information: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.

name: Pikachu
information: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

name: Raichu
information: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

name: Sandshrew
information: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.

name: Sandslash
information: It is adept at attacking with the spines on its back and its sharp claws while quickly scurrying about.
